p: Our results for p21 and p16 were less in line with expectations. The known role of p21 and p16 in cell senescence suggested their relevance as biomarkers of ageing [ 37, 58]. However, there are few studies on their links to human neurodegeneration [ 59]. It has been shown previously that p16 in brain neurons and astrocytes increases with ageing and neurodegeneration in mice and that various other senescence markers increase in neurons of ageing mice [ 33, 36]. Importantly, eradication of senescent cells in a mouse model for PD resulted in better motor function, suggesting a therapeutic benefit [ 60]. In addition, regional PD-specific white matter alterations have been correlated with increased peripheral leukocyte apoptosis and systemic inflammation [ 61].
